intro: Astragalus badachschanicus, commonly known as the Badakshan milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia, particularly Afghanistan and Pakistan. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
